amendment.description: Amendment increases and decreases funding for Childrens Mental Health Services Grants by $5 million to support school-based, early childhood mental health interventions.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 8 printed in Part B of House Report 116-109 to increase and decrease funding for Childrens Mental Health Services Grants by $5 million to support school-based, early childhood mental health interventions.

vote.text: On agreeing to the DeSaulnier amendment (A008) Agreed to by recorded vote: 369 - 55 (Roll no. 256).

action.text: Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the DeSaulnier amendment (A008) Agreed to by recorded vote: 369 - 55 (Roll no. 256).
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A008) offered by Mr. DeSaulnier.
